page.title: 16KENNELS: FARLEIGH HUNGERFORD
page.content: PREVIOUSLY KNOWN AS WICK FARM, {MONKSLEY BOARDING KENNELS}STILL FARMS 61 ACRES OF LAND. 39 ACRES ARE FOR WINTER BARLEY, 4 ARE FOR HAY, AND THE REST IS FOR GRAZING FOR THE 34 COWS AND CALVES. OTHER LIVESTOCK INCLUDES PEACOCKS, GUINEA FOWL, A GOAT, GEESE AND CHICKENS. THE KENNELS ARE KNOWN FOR BREEDING ALSATIONS, AND THE DOGS GO TO POLICE FORCES AROUND THE WORLD. THEY HAVE BEEN PLACED IN TRINIDAD, SWEDEN, AMERICA AND GERMANY, AMONG OTHERS. THERE ARE ALSO FACILITIES FOR DOGS AND CATS TO BE LOOKED AFTER WHEN THEIR OWNERS GO ON HOLIDAY. THE HOUSE ITSELF IS A 13th CENTURY FARMHOUSE BELONGING TO FARLEIGH CASTLE, AND THE LOUNGE STILL CONTAINS SOME VERY OLD BEAMS. FROM HERE, THERE WAS A PASSAGE LEADING TO THE CASTLE, BUT IT HAS BEEN BLOCKED UP.
